intro.title: Transform Difficult Conversations
intro.description: Think of a tense conversation you've had recently. We'll explore how it went without GIVE, then reframe it using Gentle, Interested, Validate, and Easy manner approaches to see the difference.

sections.title: Recall a Tense Conversation
sections.placeholder: Describe a recent conversation that felt tense, difficult, or didn't go well. What happened? Who was involved? What made it challenging?

sections.title: How It Went Without GIVE
sections.placeholder: Write how the conversation actually went. What tone did you use? How did you respond to the other person? What was the outcome?

subsections.title: Be Gentle - How could you approach this more gently?
subsections.placeholder: Use a softer tone, avoid harsh words, be kind in your approach.

subsections.title: Show Interest - How could you show genuine interest in their perspective?
subsections.placeholder: Ask questions, listen actively, show curiosity about their viewpoint...

subsections.title: Validate - How could you acknowledge their feelings or perspective?
subsections.placeholder: 'I can see why you'd feel that way.' 'That makes sense given...' 'I understand this is important to you...'

subsections.title: Easy Manner - How could you approach this in a more relaxed, easy manner?
subsections.placeholder: Smile, use humor appropriately, stay relaxed, avoid being too serious or intense...

sections.title: Write the Full GIVE Conversation
sections.placeholder: Now write how the entire conversation could have gone using all GIVE principles together. What would you say differently?

subsections.title: What differences do you notice between the two approaches?
subsections.placeholder: How might the other person have responded differently? What would the outcome have been?

subsections.title: What insights did you gain about using GIVE?
subsections.placeholder: Which GIVE element would be most helpful for you? What surprised you about this exercise?

subsections.title: How will you apply GIVE in future conversations?
subsections.placeholder: What specific situations could benefit from GIVE? Which element will you focus on first?
